content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												This is almost everything I've ever wanted out of a Shadowrun game. The combat takes some getting used to if you're used to a more turn based style, though if you do want to pause to issue orders, a skill has been added to allow a massive slowdown in time for just that purpose. That said, the depth of options and customization is surprisingly varied. You can clear things using just stealth or just combat, or go for a hybrid of the two. The number of options for getting from point A to B is also really enjoyable. Gotta make it through a door? You could cut the power, hack the door, hijack a personnel member who has access, use an explosive satchel on the door, etc. This same sense of possibility exists for just about each point of infiltrations. I very much recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												This is basically the Commandos series in a cyberpunk style. I liked it, but it was definitely not as difficult as the Commandos series, and it didn't offer depth in the right places. Still, it was a cool game that I enjoyed playing. Here's some pro's and cons that I experienced!Pro's Commandos style gameplay, offering a tactical strategy game with 4 (sometimes more) distinct and original characters. Nice cyberpunk design. Clear directions of what to do and where to go to (this tends to be pretty vague at these kind of games). Rewarding stealth gameplay. Multiple paths to one solution (though sometimes this is cheap - like a door that has a terminal next to it that you can hack to open it, but there's also a machine right on the other side to "hardwire" it, giving almost the same result: the door opens).Cons I would have liked more diverse situations. I had a character with a sniper rifle that I rarely used, as there were never any truly good spots to use the range to your advantage. The ending was really poor. The same boss came back over and over again. Not to mention the awful music at the end that totally didn't fit the entire ambiance of the game. The story, it's simply not good. Only the highlights in the storyline missions have real voiced dialogue, which isn't all that special to begin with. That's about five times. The story is not captivating, and even though I thought the ending was pretty cool, it didn't make any sense (in the last minute a new female person was introduced with a significant role, that altered ending of the story, but either I missed something or I had no idea who they were talking about). Overly complex systems such as the research system and the cloning system. It didn't really add to the gameplay, it just made it unnecessarily complex (I did like the income system tho - that was kind of different than usual!).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
												So where to start.  Pro's:Expansive world, its H U G E fortunately there is fast travel waypoints.  Adjustable traffic & civilain foot traffic.  Well detailed and interactable for example you can put siphons on ATM machines.  Shut off cameras, hack security systems, talk with certain NPC civilians.Combat feels impactful, missing a beat or forgetting to buff your teammates during a fight can mean life or death.  AI is good enough to feel that often times your best choice is to simply run away and find a more easily defensable position pop a few cops and then put your guns away and hopfully avoid Drones and Cameras long enough for your "wanted level" to go down essentially.  Also I love that there is an actual "wanted level" meter in the game, gives you that option to jump on and say what the hell lets see how long I can surivive with 5 stars.  Lots of weapons, attachements, and augmentations to choose from that give a WHOLE LOT of customizability to each and every character.Graphics are actually really nice the only thing I don't like is the outfits your team is given default glow and you can't see a lot of detail on them.  Fortunately that isn't true for the other characters in the game, and you can get better gear later on in the game.  Story, the story isn't what I'd call deep but it's there and if you want to do some reading into the missions and story its actually really cool.  Essentially in the future at some point a megacorp figures out whats called Rez Tech, exactly what it sounds like.  The technology to transfer consciousness from human to computer to another human.  The Corp uses this first for political power only offering immoratility to those who can offer them power.  They then build a small army and sieze control of major cities and at this point esstentially controller the area.  Your a group of mercs motivated to remove said Corp from their seat of power.  I would sum this game up by calling it a expansive shadowrun, while its missing a noticable "class system" there is classes, but instead of it being combat oriented its more ability oriented while everyone can do eveything up to a point.  Everyone can Hack but a hacker can break in bank systems and steal you money while a non-hacker may be able to open a door they can't do that.  I like it a lot so far and would reccommend it.Cons:The game is optimized to a point where you'd think such a small game with low req's should be.  try turning off shadows that did it for me.  ITS H U G E the first mission consists of you planting fast travel/vendor stations around the city and you realize how huge it is and you can't believe you have to run all this way and figure out w t h to do.  Stick out the first mission and the game gets AWESOME real quick.  Once you get a handle on the expansiveness and the combat you'll have a ball.  I feel for first time RPG players this game has a big learning curve.  If you've played shadowrun or divinity you'll be fine or related games.  But if your new to real time RPG games, take it slow don't skip the tutorial and finish the first mission and you will have fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 4, 2016
												I liked the original Syndicate. This game is not Syndicate. Pretty far from it. And in a good way. While syndicate was a run and gun type of game, and you were the one shooting and aiming, this handles like a tactical rpg.While the graphics are pretty good though obviously not the best there is and the game has some rough edges here and there in the form of bugs or control issues, the guys making this beauty really loved their job. Or knew what they had to do.The game has a surprising depth and everything in it is to make gameplay better. No unnecessary trash, no handholding, it's quite brutal, yet at the same time it allows you to try again as many times as you want.Kind of like Santa with a knife. He stabs you, but smiles while doing it and then even bandages you, waits till you heal up... then stabs you again.Those that like coop or even just single player, are in luck - the game works nicely though as mentioned some bugs my surface - since you can drop in drop out, coop client control loss issues are easily circumvented and they rarely pop up thankfully (while at the same time this is the only actual bug I can name, don't remember any others).It's like why indie games are usually better than AAA titles, personified. Basically you trade polish for depth and true entertainment. Okay, the ending could use some work in my opinion but overall it was worth the cost I paid for it. Not many games can say that about themselves, on sale or not.Job well done and it shows.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												+leveldesign (really well made maps, lots of variety and options presented)+setting/atmosphere (gritty/gloomy-cyberpunk-zaibatsu-world)+style (well themed writing, graphics, music and sound effects)+fanservice (Bullfrog's syndicate-fans should love it)+ironman mode (and designed to work with it)-missing AAA-polish (UI needs some love, horrible default control settings, overall balancing)-occasional A-bugs (stuck in terrain/crash that need a load & replaying to fix)-Camera/Controlls/lack of Agent AI makes it quite impossible to try and use fancy tactics like in for example XCom, which faster leads to a lack of variety in gameplay (there are a lot of mechanics, you just don't have the controll needed to use all the exploits, you probably end up brute forcing most of your problems)Almost gave up on this game before I even began playing it (got one of my characters stuck in a wall during the tutorial, where you can't save). Had to replay roughly 1-3h total (of 35h for playthrough) due to ironman mode + bugs.Luckily with this version you could choose to have the slow time down upgrade from the start, which I found myself using a lot (especially in the early game, while learing the mechanics). I might not have gotten into the game without this option available at the start.Especially since I chose the ironman mode. Which works well for this game. It more or less forces you to reload if one of your agents die during a mission, which to me feels like a fair tradeoff (hardcore mode wouldn't work, imo, as the game is now).There are multiple ways to tackle the missions. Usually several ways to enter the secure areas and approce your target. There is also the full range of going full stealth to full combat (both seam to work fine). Cudos to the level designers.The story/lore is completly optional. You can enjoy this game on its mechanics alone.Overall a good game, got a bit repetative towards the 4th map (5 total, last map is the final mission).

Posted: December 12, 2016
												Having just completed my first run of this game, I gotta say that it's a lot of fun, but a little slow in the beginning. The amount of micromanagement can vary, and when you don't have many options (like in the first district) you may spend a long time in each compound, since you're poor and probably didn't outfit all your agents with silencers.Now, I never played Syndicate Wars or whatever this game is dubbed to be the spiritual successor to, but the factions, lore and weapons all fit perfectly with their respective styles. The atmosphere is bleak, as is your mission. Push through each district and witness terribly awful things happen to your agents, like when a giant robot fires a plasma mortar and wipes all your agents into a purple paste as well as approaching each obstacle in an opportunistic way, such as taking contol of a 10 foot tall, minigun toting robot and ordering it to squish every guard in the checkpoint to make it to the next district. You'll have fun, if you're into this sort of tactical stealth style. You'll also not have fun, as an inconvenient angle gets you spotted and surrounded and subsequently killed. Either way, when you make it to the end, you'll see the height of what your digital people can accomplish. miniguns are sorta trash, avoid the ballistic one. laser one is alright

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 6, 2015
												I've played Satellite Reign for about 12 hours (6 hours weren't counted due to offline mode).Even though I was a huge fan of Syndicate (Wars), I never kickstarted this because the kickstarter seemed to promote fancy graphics over gameplay. When they came out of Early Access I bought the game because I was curious and left me pleasantly surprised.The game feels very much Syndicaty to me. You roam around a city doing cyborgy stuff, and there's plenty to do. It can be quite challenging, and you more or less get to set your own pace. In a way SR does some things better than the original that inspired this title; the things you do in the world make a lot more sense and serve you well, and the agent specialization and skill system work really well.That said, the game isn't without its flaws. Combat can be frustrating (due to technical issues; responsiveness of agents, pathfinding, enemy spawning, illogical terminal placements, etc), the other side of the coin means that it can be incredibly rewarding when you /do/ manage to complete a mission.(TLDR) Despit its flaws, it's still a really interesting game that plays unlike anything else that was released in recent years, and well worth the price they're asking (which at this time of writing is below 30 euro). But if you're someone who gets frustrated easily, you may want to skip this one.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												I really enjoyed this game. Syndicate was one of my favourite games and so backed this without hesitation on Kickstarter and it delivered more than I expected. The game is a spiritual successor in the best possible way. There are moments in the game where it perfectly captures the feel of syndicate but it is very much its own game that isn't afraid to change things up and experiment.Exploring the city and planning out how to attack a facility is lots of fun, and once you're in, you often have to change your plans quickly, switching from a stealth infiltration to blasting your way in and out when things go wrong. The game gives you plenty of tools for both options and I got a lot of enjoyment from raiding the same facilities in different ways to complete all the objectives. Overall, great fun, capturing the spirit of a great game while delivering a modern take on the concept.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												I took my time to finish off this game before writing any kind of review. And hear me out... It's like sindicate and paradice cracked mixed up together and it's actually really quite enjoyable and challenging game. You get to play as a sort of ciberpunk ISIS operative cell, who dedicate themselfs to bring down the man, the old corporations who are ruling the world. Your group was created by a different corporation, staying in the shadows with a single purpouse to bring down the cloning company using their own tricks against them. So, grab your popcorn, grab your can of tactical bacon and get ready for a threat. You got at your disposition tons of gadgets, implants, abilities and guns of all sorts and shapes. How you want to do it, it's completelly up to you. Make small stealth heists or upgrade your hacker to brainwash the enemies and bring a gоddамn army to their doors. Your choise. Map is separated in 4 section (5, actually) and you get to choose where to strike and how you do it, it's pretty much a open world, so you are the one who are calling the shots. What should be do the next course of action. Personally, I just used a hacker and a bunch of civils and random guards to knock on enemy's door. It's really fun, once you get used to it. Learn well your team abilities, buff up by raiding enemy structures and don't forget to research new prototypes, most of them will add quite a bit of new tactical features.So... To make it shorter: It's a good game and in my personal opinion, it even managed to surpass both the original Paradise Cracked and Sindicate. It does worth your money, if you are into open world tactical games with good coop, look no further, this is the one you should try. 10/10, would blow the CEO the fucк up once again.

content:
Posted: January 6
												This game is a real-time tactical RPG. It's like a blend between shadowrun and deus ex, but the story falls by the wayside. It's a very indie feel. This game did one other important thing well: it gives you a bunch of different tools and actually makes you want to use them to solve problems. I could see several different legitimate play styles being viable. This is probably the first stealth game I've ever played that got the stealth detection mechanics perfectly right. You can allow your operatives to be detained by simply not resisting, and sometimes thats the best approach. You can fight if you are kitted out for a fight. If you run and hide, the enemy is not relentless and cheaty in its ability to find you. The stealth balance is spot on.Replayability: Not much for single player. Where this game would really shine is with 3 of your mates, definitely a sure pickup for coop potential.Play time you can get: 20-30 hours completionist single player (same for multiplayer).Performance: With a GTX 970 I was almost always sub 30fps at 1080p medium settings, but strangly I found it tolerable. This game is poorly optimized.Very few bugs and the primary drawbacks are, since it is an indie feeling title, it lacks real depth. Missions can get repetitive after a while, and there isn't much substance in the overworld. Still, given the prices you can get it on sale, it's a worthy buy.

Posted: January 7
												Though it has a bit of a learning curve and the first few hours can be exceptionally frustrating if you stick with it it is a rather fun game. The puzzles and strategy aspect is not too difficult once you get the hang of it, the humour of hacking rival corps and sending them to their doom as a distraction never seems to get old. Just don't get too attached to your agents. Allowing them to die and respawning them is all part of the game. The story is lacking and you can completely forget there even is a story if you don't hack the datapoints, though it does kinda have one with an odd twist ending. If you wait for it to be on sale then it is fine for a few days of few days of glorified neon strategic killing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3
About the gameSatellite Reign is a cyberpunk-themed RPG, in which you control 4 different characters at once.Most of the game is either based on stealth or combat, depending on your preference. The vast majority of the missions can be done either way.Is it open-world?Not really. To me, for a game to be open-world, the world actually needs something to do in it. Satellite Reign has more of a hub with certain areas in which you do missions.The core of the game is to do missions in each area to aquire items, which make your characters stronger. Some of these items are weapons, some are stat upgrades, others give your characters new abilities.Other than that, there's no reason to remain in a district after every mission has been completed.Singleplayer vs. MultiplayerI highly recommend you to play this game together with at least one friend. Team communication is very important, so be sure to use a VoIP service when you play.Singleplayer is possible, but controlling 4 characters (or more) at once is just incredibly difficult. Even controlling two at once is sometimes hard.Is the game fun? How long does it last?Absolutely! After a tough battle or an intense stealth section, you feel quite the reward, simply for beating the mission.I played the game for about 28 hours from start to finish together with a friend and we really had a blast while we played.As for replayability, there is not really that much of a reason to play it more than once.Sure, you could do an "all stealth" or "all loud" run if you want, but the XP and skill system doesn't force you to make any choices.The only choice you have is which skills to get first.Is the game stable?It's a bit of a mixed bag. In general, I'd call it stable.Multiplayer over internet works fine, but Multiplayer over LAN does not work at all.The game itself doesn't crash and can be minimized without problem.However, sometimes the characters in-game start to glitch out. Once (in 28 hours of gameplay), my character got stuck and died.At times, characters are slow to respond to commands, especially if they choose to reload after switching targets, or if they have to put their gun away.All in all, I would say these can be annoying when they happen, but it's not frequent enough to really spoil the fun.Does it perform well?This is the only major downside. If you have a very weak CPU, then the game doesn't perform well at all (State: Jan 2017).As far as I could read from forum entries, the developers vowed to improve the performance. If you have a very weak CPU, don't expect top performance.SummaryAll in all, Satellite Reign is 20-30 hours worth of multiplayer fun. If you have a friend to play with, give it a shot!

												Overall - I recommend this game. Definitely enjoyable, esepecaily if you're fan of Syndicate Wars. Pros: - Detailed expressions of the city of destopian future, with excellent cyberpunk atmosphere. - Co-op play available. - Good follow of the Syndicate Wars with the same feeling. If you still remember Syndicate Wars, this game would be great- Sneaky and stealthy play - Good system regarding upgrade clones, gears, and weapons. - Good ecomomic balance (researching and blueprint are expensive but IMO this idea is good). Cons: - Need more optimizaiton between performance and graphic. - Too laggy Co-op play, (sometimes) almost impossible to enjoy. - A bit easier battle and tricks when compared to Syndicate Wars. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19
												A game with a cool setting, awesome toys but a bit rough around the edges.  If you can look past the bugs and the difficulty spike in the middle, it definitely a gem in the rough.Pros:- Cool Cyberpunk world with lots of beautiful scenery- Lots of toys (augments, gear and weapons) to outfit your troops with.- Pulling off a mission with either stealth or brute force feels awesome!Cons:- Bugs.  I'm particularly sick of having my guys get randomly stuck in walls. :(- UX problems: there are times when you issue orders and they just don't take.  Very annoying as things can go downhill quickly on a mission.- Braindead AI, particularly for your guys.  They will stand around getting shot even though they have their guns out.  Won't take cover even when it's right in front of them.  Will shoot at a wall instead of the enemy.  You get used to when you have babysit them, but it's annoying that you have to do it at all.- Big diffculty spike in the middle of the game: right about after you clear the first area, the missions get much harder (see tips below for dealing with that).- "Going loud" in the early to mid game will probably get your team killed.  Later in the game once you have outfitted yourself with all the cool toys, you can easily mow down lots of enemies.  Thus the game actually gets easier later on as you can survive the mission when you screw up sneaking around.Tips:- Always do the bank mission ASAP and then hack all of the ATMs.  Half (or more) of the strength of your team is the gear you have, so more money = stronger team.- After you clear the first area and have access to the next two, go to both and do the bank missions plus ATMs.  Then use your new found money to gear up as the mission will be much harder now.- Abuse the stealth instant skill, especially with the infiltrator.  It's easy to get behind a patrol using the cloak and then murder them all before they can respond.- Grenades are powerful.  Make sure to equip them and use them on groups of enemies.  Grenades do lots damage, blow up cover and knock down enemies.- Plasma and laser weapons are the way to go.  They're stats might not look much better than bullet weapons, but shields and armor are harder to remove than regular health, so you need weapons that have bonuses against those.- Heavy weapons are mostly meh.  The exception being the rocket launcher and the plasma canon.  These are basically "guns" that shoot "grenades" :)

content:
Posted: February 6
												Satellite Reign has a cyberpunk, matrix, blade runner kind of feel  to it.  Its a real time tactical rpg where you level up four agents as they hack and infiltrate corporate compounds throughout the cityscape.  Essentially, the game works like this:  your agents steal technology and money so they can get better gear to steal technology and money from other areas in the city.  Along the way they level up to assist in these hacking/stealing/infiltrating ventures.  Rinse and repeat.  I have been playing for about 28 hours and I am almost through my second city district.  So this will keep you busy.Good game but buy it on sale.  This game is on sale a lot during the year.  I picked it up for about $10, but I have seen it as low as $5.

content:
Posted: January 29
												Really good at letting you approach missions your own way and creating emergent gameplay.  Stealth, hacking, and direct combat are all viable options, and sometimes you'll want to use more than one in a single mission. Enemies are appropriately difficult if the alarms go off, but don't result in an automatic loss. There are always multiple viable ways to approach any problem. As others have mentioned, there are some glitches and problems with pathing, but none of them were frequent enough to substantially detract from my enjoyment. I had an awesome time playing this, and I hope they release a sequel

content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												I loved the original Syndicate, and this game manages to give us a modern replacement, with a few caveats.  It has a great atmosphere and graphics, which really nails the Syndicate feel, with a modern take.  Sound effects are also great.  Unlike Syndicate, the designers give you the option of using stealth or going in guns-a-blazing, which is a nice addition.  Unfortunately, stealth is the easiest, an possibly only practical method to complete some missions, so instead of controlling badass terminator agents you often feel like you are controlling weaklings who have to sneak around and get killed the minute they are noticed.  And that will happen a lot because the unchangable difficulty level is pretty hard, so expect to replay lots of missions many times.  It's also worth noting that you can't save in the middle of a mission, so you have to replay the whole mission, some of which can be pretty lengthy.  Restarting from a save point is also super slow.  OTOH once you get past (in my case struggle past) the earlier parts of the game and finally level your agents up sufficently, the game starts to open up a bit and is a ton of fun.  It just that there is some frustration to get there.  Still, if you liked the original Syndicate and Syndicate Wars, you owe it to yourself to get this game.

												Not played many hours yet but my initial impression is that it a faithful adaption of the old syndicate style games, 4 man team, large areas, in fact the map is open world, to explore, can take control of people, skills to learn and things to research. I can happily recommend this for anyone who is looking for something like syndicate or just likes squad based games. Although there is no tactical pause but there is an option to enable a form of it when you start a new game, not sure if this classes as a cheat mode or not but it works for me.

												I am hooked on this game because it is like Syndicate Wars with 201x graphics and gameplay. I loved Syndicate Wars as a kid on our 486.It is a little hard to play without a mouse without a zoom wheel, as the levels are very detailed requiring close in to click on things and then wanting to get an overal picture of things.
